Articles.Content: I told you not to eat that strange meteorite. And now look at you, you and your 1000 spawn are going to conquer Kerbin...
looks like gyro kraken or save file editing, this is funny, sadly you aren't getting that much attention...
Could it be? Krakens are made from mutated kerbals?
The kerbokraken? Or something like that... Anyway it looks both hilarious and very scary

"WERNHER!"

"Ja, mein boss?"

"What did i tell you about those genetic experiments! And with KRAKEN!"

"But, mein boss..."

"One more spawned kraken, and you will fly in a rocket yourself!"

"Okay, mein boss...."

*Wernher von Kerman walks away sadly*

From a further distance Barski will actually launch these abominations into the sky. Not much detail in the screenshot from the launchpad though. Not sure why this is happening. Had no problem till last night Bill started doing this on Minmus, but just himself. So I went and put Barski at the end of the runway alone so I could view what a "Normal" EVA should look like in the persistance file, what happened was this though =/ Also there was a capsule next to him, but his spawns blew it up lol.

Edited March 2, 2014 by Kilmeister

From a further distance Barski will actually launch these abominations into the sky. Not much detail in the screenshot from the launchpad though. Not sure why this is happening. Had no problem till last night Bill started doing this on Minmus, but just himself. So I went and put Barski at the end of the runway alone so I could view what a "Normal" EVA should look like in the persistance file, what happened was this though =/ Also there was a capsule next to him, but his spawns blew it up lol.

I have a feeling that somewhere in a rural region in Rominia, a computer hacker is laughing.

I suggest a reinstall, unless you want the holycrapitsademonkerbalsquidoius calamarian to strangle, eat, then asslimate every kerbal there.

Then a anti-virus scan.

Do it ten times, to make sure whatever virus caused it is dead, dead, dead.

Make sure you uninstall Internet Exploder.

Also, I concur on the Kraken hypothesis. No Kerbal shall look up to the sky with hope, and this day shall be cursed by ye who have awakened the Kraken.
now I am thinking of dave barsky from dirty jobs . him as a kerbal makes me laugh ..

It looks like the game spawned many instances of Barski inside each other for no apparent reason... Do you have RemoteTech installed? Because I've had a few satellites spawn four instances of itself in the same place, leading to lots of 'splosions the second I loaded them

It can well be kerbals slowly fusing into each other as part of their mutation, all started out by one kerbal who got the virus which transforms him into a kraken, but obviously biomass is needed for the new kraken to be born.
